meanings.definition: Having all necessary parts or elements
meanings.sent1: The puzzle was complete with all its pieces.
meanings.sent2: The team needed all players to be complete for the game.
meanings.sent3: The complete set of markers made the artist very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as complete as a rainbow after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The garden was complete with colorful flowers blooming everywhere.

meanings.sent1: She will complete her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He needs to complete the project by the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: The chef will complete the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent4: The final piece of the puzzle completed the picture.
meanings.sent5: The last stroke of the brush completed the painting beautifully.

meanings.sent1: Adding the missing ingredient will complete the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The final touch will complete the look of the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand to complete the illusion.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter completed the joyous atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The last note of the song completed the melody perfectly.
